about_the_game:
You died... but it's not over.

The last thing you remember is the glare of headlights and the impact of a truck. Now, instead of eternal rest, you find yourself standing at the gates of heaven. But this is no paradise. Instead of peace, you’re given a new job: feeding god.

In Hunger of Heaven, death isn’t the end. It’s the start of a dangerous and strange task. Your only way forward is to meet god’s endless demands, but surviving in this grim afterlife won’t be easy.

Gather, Survive, Deliver

To complete your mission, you’ll need to gather enough supplies to meet the quota. But this world is full of threats, and you’ll have to make tough decisions along the way:

  • Explore and scavenge: Search for the supplies you need to stay alive and satisfy god’s hunger.

  • Survive the dangers: The afterlife isn’t safe, and there are those who don’t want you to succeed.

  • Manage your resources: Will you use your medkit now to survive, or save it to count toward your quota?

The Cost of Feeding God

Every choice matters. What you keep for yourself might help you live another day, but it could mean falling short of the quota. Sacrifice too much, and you may not survive long enough to finish the job.

Do you have what it takes to endure this grim afterlife and finally earn your rest? Or will you be trapped forever in god’s endless hunger?

Hunger of Heaven challenges you to think, adapt, and survive in a haunting world where even death has a price.

Game Features

  • Dual Wielding: Forget inventories—everything you collect must be carried in your hands. Choose wisely and plan your actions carefully.

  • Item Management: Decide how to use the items you find. Will you use them to survive, or sacrifice them to meet your quota? Every choice matters.

  • Dynamic Movement: Crawl, crouch, sprint, and vault to navigate dangerous environments and evade threats.

  • Leaning Mechanics: Peek around corners to stay one step ahead and ensure the coast is clear before moving forward.

content_descriptors.notes: Depictions of death, harm to person and potentially upsetting religious themes
